concept.title: Generalizing data element specializations
concept.shortdesc: Specializations of the <data> element may be subject to formatting or other output processing, but when generalized to <data> these behaviors are lost.

conbody.draft-comment: I think this topic should be integrated with the language reference entry for <data> since it is purely about the semantics and use of <data> and not about specialization in general.

section.note:
It might be tempting to specialize the element for text that is part of the body flow, so as to escape the constraints of the base content models. This abuse of the DITA architecture will cause problems. For example, if you specialize a particular kind of paragraph from rather than from

, then when content is exchanged with others or when the specialization is retired, that specialized element will be generalized to , and the base formatting will skip it, with undesired effects on discourse flow.
